issue_description:
# Tutorial to Predict the Rating of Cars

## Task Description
Create a predictor to predict the rating of cars based on their technical specification.

Use the `CARS_1.csv` dataset available at https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/tr1gg3rtrash/cars-2022-dataset.

## :loudspeaker: Additional rewards :trophy:

Each tutorial brings :three: points and entry into the draw for a  :point_down: :

-  :computer:  [Razer Blade 15 Laptop](https://www.razer.com/hard-bundles/Razer-Blade-15-Bundle-V5-Essential/RZHB-220912-11)
- :headphones:  10 cool audio gadgets 
- :shirt: :bear: MindsDB Swag
:information_source: For more info check out https://mindsdb.com/hacktoberfest/ :point_left:

issue_comments.body: Hello, can I work on this issue?
Hello, can I please be assigned to also work on this issue? Thank you.
Hey can I work on this issue? Pls assign me to this @ZoranPandovski

This tutorial is already assigned.
Please have a look at the [Hacktoberfest issues here](https://github.com/mindsdb/mindsdb/issues) or come up with a tutorial you would like to create. Thanks.

> 

Where do I come up with a tutorial I would like to create? @martyna-mindsdb

@dhaneshragu
You can look up the [datasets available at Kaggle](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets) to get some ideas for a tutorial.

hello @martyna-mindsdb, in which format can I submit the tutorial for this predicting rating car using mindsdb?
Article or video?

Hi @StarTrooper08,
Any format is welcome. Usually, our tutorials are articles.

Hello @martyna-mindsdb my article is ready where can I submit it?
https://atharva08.hashnode.dev/predicting-the-rating-of-cars-using-mindsdb
I've to submit the pull request link in the form right?
But for the article should I add issue link in the form?

@StarTrooper08
Please create a PR to submit your article. Thanks!

https://github.com/mindsdb/mindsdb/pull/3430

@martyna-mindsdb I've created PR for the same

# Tutorial to Predict the Rating of Cars

## Task Description
Create a predictor to predict the rating of cars based on their technical specification.

Use the `CARS_1.csv` dataset available at https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/tr1gg3rtrash/cars-2022-dataset.
